parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.
Belonging to Cyrene, a Cyrenaean. From Kurene; i.e. Cyrenaean, i.e. Inhabitant of Cyrene.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
From the same as alektor and aner; man-defender; Alexander, the name of three Israelites and one other man.
Of Latin origin; red; Rufus, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To pass by, depart, pass away. From para and ago; to lead near, i.e. to go along or away.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular

str2: From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From ago; a field; genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. Hamlet.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Of foreign origin; properly, to be a courier, i.e. to press into public service.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
